page.title: 01BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY. SUMMARY.
page.content: A village of some 170 residents, Bowness lies on the South side of the narrowest part of the Solway estuary. Built on the site of the Roman fort, Maia, it marks the traditional Western extremity of Hadrian's Wall. Its narrow winding construction clearly illustrates its defensive origins. Approach roads are marked with warning signs of tidal flooding which at times cuts off the village, albeit briefly. The traveller in the area will be delighted by the variety of wading birds, the abundance of wild flowers, and the amazing sunsets, but will be disappointed that there are few signs of its Roman history. Bowness has a church, chapel, school, P.O., Tel., pub & regular buses to Carlisle.{(BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY HEREAFTER {ABBREVIATED TO B'NESS/SOLWAY). {
